intro: Callirhoe bushii, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing, herbaceous perennial that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of pink to violet. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions and requires minimal water once established. Callirhoe bushii is often used in xeriscaping due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
